content:
Your donations however large or small will enable even more innovative and inspirational projects to be funded by the CCF. Click below to find out how to donate to the CCF or click on the legacy button to find out about leaving a gift to the CCF in your Will.
If you have been inspired by what you have seen and read on our website you may want to consider leaving a legacy to the Church and Community Fund in your will. By investing in the Fund you will be investing in creative social outreach and mission ideas that will help the Church actively serve their local communities. Projects supported by the CCF make the isolated feel part of a community, help the church to engage with young people, pull people out of unemployment and aid the Church to be a the heart of community life. Such active community engagement can in turn lead to spiritual and numerical growth in local churches. Whilst you may wish to consider supporting your local parish church, a gift to the CCF is a way in which you can also support the work of other parishes. The CCF particularly supports those parishes working in areas of rural and urban deprivation.
Over half of the population of England have not yet made a Will and of those who have, 50% do not keep it up to date. Creating a Will and keeping it up to date is the best way to make sure that your loved ones will be looked after in the way you want.
The Church Legacy website gives some very good advice about how to go about writing a Will.
If you do decide to leave a gift to The Church and Community Fund here are some important pieces of information you may need:

Discover the charm of the ‘village within a city’ that belongs to the true Portuguese people!
When and where
Date and time
Location
Rossio Square Praça Dom Pedro IV 1100-202 Lisboa Portugal
Map and directions
How to get there
About this event
Wander around the steep, narrow streets of what people often call the village within the city. Alfama is one of the few districts in Lisbon not destroyed by the earthquake of 1755.
Decorated in beautiful ‘azulejos’ (tiles), the steep winding alleys of this neighborhood give way to breath-taking views of a sea of terracotta roofs and the Tagus River. The aromas of traditional Portuguese cuisine, the echoes of Fado tunes, and the elderly Portuguese locals chattering, all make this neighborhood one of the most authentic in Lisbon!
We'll see Lisboa's most emblematic landmarks, like the Rossio Square, Dona Maria II Theatre, Sao Domingos Church, Figueira Square, Sao Jorge Castle, Portas do Sol viewpoint, Sé Cathedral.
Tie your most comfortable shoes and get lost in time in historical Lisbon with our expert tour guides.
Meet us every day at D. Pedro IV Square (Rossio). You can find our yellow shirted team with yellow umbrellas near the statue, right in the middle.

I’m not exaggerating when I say that this is THE BEST deodorant I’ve ever used. And I’ve tried many, many deodorants.
I don’t know if I sweat weird or what, but it’s not been easy finding a deodorant that works well for me. Sorry if that’s an overshare, but it is a testament to how good this stuff is!
I also want to say that if you’re already a fan of charcoal deodorant, of the various ones I’ve tried, this is my favorite.
https://www.amazon.com/stores/Cleo%2BCoco/page/4BA1E2B1-8FEA-49CA-AC37-F2B53ED9B70F?ref_=ast_bln
Kelitch Bracelet
I’m linking the shop here:
https://www.amazon.com/stores/KELITCH/page/B022E865-341A-47D0-88BB-F9B1730BE277?ref_=ast_bln
Very well priced, cute, a lot of variety. By the way, have only ever purchased bracelets, they are great, but I can’t vouch for any of their other products.
I have bought a couple of bracelets from Kelitch, these are most recent:
Lifestraw Pitcher
Enjoying this water filter pitcher that I purchased last week; although I’m thinking I should have bought the 10 cup rather than the 7.
Nice aesthetics, and different options and styles available for the pitchers: plastic, glass, sizes, colors.
Here’s a screenshot of the one I bought, linked just below the picture.
Lifestraw has plenty of other products available as well, if you’re a camper I’d definitely check out their filtration systems.
Budget Book
I’m one of those people who likes to write things down. There are tons of budgeting apps, but I prefer the old fashioned way of tracking my spending.
Nothing too earthshattering here, but it looks nice, the layout is simple and straightforward, and there are charts etc as well should you like to use them (I never do).
It’s also less than $15, which I think is pretty good. I took a lot of time trying to find the “perfect” budgeting tracker book, and this is the one that I ended up picking. Definitely recommend!
Monthly & Weekly Budget Planner Organizer – Financial Budgeting Book & Expense Tracker – Control Your Finances – Undated Start Anytime, 12 Months https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07LB7NP69/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fab_uatAFbTKQXY8G
Last but not least:
Essential oil storage box:
This is SO great. Very simple, very useful, and very well made
Comes with stickers as well for labeling bottles. As you can see, this doesn’t fit larger bottles of oil. But that’s fine for me; the small bottles of oil are always the ones that end up in a mess and I can’t find what I’m looking for!
This has really been helpful in keeping organized. Here’s the link: Essential Oil Wooden Box – Oils Storage Case Holds 68 Bottles & Roller Balls. Natural Pine Wood. Large Organizer Best for Keeping Your Oils Safe. Includes Padding and EO Labels https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01A07QAEC/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fab_p.wAFbS5CKPXS
So there you have it, some of my favorite Amazon buys of recent. Comment if you have any Amazon recommendations!

In the previous video clips we spoke about Single Line of Text, Choice and Lookup Columns. Site Columns takes us one step higher, allowing us to reuse columns on subsites as well. I always create my Site Columns as a Lookup – not as choices, which means normal end users can maintain the lookup list for me, and the Site Column points to it. Voila!!
Purpose of this blog challenge: I will write 365 blogs in 365 days around Microsoft 365. I did a similar challenge with Office 365, blogs can be found https://tracyvanderschyff.com/microsoft-365/ . I won’t just be talking about the new Microsoft 365 subscription model. I will be sharing any news, tips and tricks around Office / Office 365 / Windows / Mobility and Security. And let’s not forget all the great new Apps & services available. A lot of what I’ll share on Office and SharePoint will also be applicable to none “Office 365” versions.
“You can also find me contributing to REgarding 365. I’m a member of a group of enthusiasts, sharing their stories, thoughts and opinions about Microsoft 365. Catch us at https://regarding365.com | @regarding365 on Twitter and regarding365 on YouTube https://www.youtube.com/regarding365 ”
Disclaimer: I create content about Office / Microsoft 365. Content is accurate at time of publication, however updates and new additions happen daily which could change the accuracy or relevance. Please keep this in mind when using my blogs as guidelines.

Small Yet Magical.
This is my third story to the site. I am extremely grateful to The Secret team, the staff and Rhonda for the amazing teaching!! I am a firm believer of the LOA. Here is my magical story.
I have been using a 6 to 7 year old laptop and for sometime now, about the last 6 months, my laptop started giving me a problem with its keypad. Four to five keys on my laptop’s keyboard stopped working. I had lot of trouble using it but somehow I was still managing it. I prayed to the Universe to fix this problem like magic. I then just forgot that I had asked for this to God and the Universe and I was using all the time just the way it was.
Guess what?!! After all these months, just today, my laptop’s keys started functioning perfectly! Just as if it had got repaired by an engineer or perhaps the Universe itself! This is not with just one key but all the keys started working smoothly and the problem disappeared just like magic.
I am very, very thankful and I am in total awe with the works of the Universe and God. This may sound like a small thing but this is a teaching to me and to all of us that when we believe and let go of our doubts and feel blessed with all that is given to us, the Universe is bound to deliver everything that we ask for. Thank you, thank you, thank you! Cheers.

- This event has passed.
Improvement Districts Webinar: Engaging Local Politicians
23 May, 2019 @ 10:30 am - 11:30 am
23 May 2019 | 10:30-11:30 | Online seminar:
Locally elected politicians are powerful influencers in local communities. They can be a source of support and help, and they have a mandate to hold local service providers accountable for their performance. Working closely and constructively with them is important for any organisation doing work in their local area.
In this session, we consider how best to engage with local politicians both proactively and reactively, and a more substantial session outline will be issued to participants in advance.
The training will be delivered by Message Matters, a leading Scottish strategic communications and political relations firm.
Booking and Viewing Details
https://zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_DnxtIczIT6KgGBDtSd6ozA
If you have any queries, please contact Elaine Bone at elaine@improvementdistricts.scot.

Posted by Ian
Another lovely warm and sunny day (18c at 6-30am!).
All nine tufted ducklings seem to be doing ok but I haven’t seen the mother duck for two days.Was she just out of sight?.
The remaing two cygnets are thriving along with a recent clutch of mallard ducklings.
The long pond water level keeps dropping all the time it is not that long ago the level was up to the top of the fence posts (see pic).

Fiesta of Santa Fe, Cebu.
1888
Birth in Carmen, Cebu, of Mariano Jesus Cuenco (1888-1964), lawyer-journalists who became Cebu congressman, governor, and Philippine Cabinet member and Senate Preisdent.
1895
Birth in Talisay, Cebu, of Priscillo A. Campo, a leading Cebuano poet better-known by his pseudonym, “Bukidnon.”
1900
General Arcadio Maxilom issues a decree ordering a shift to guerilla warfare and reorganizing the military organization of the Republic in Cebu to support the war against the Americans.

Carly Walton, the creator of Teach Music Online, is back for part #2 of the Connecting the Private Studio series, this time focused on the top tech tools for private studio teachers. In Part 1 she shared her story about moving her private lessons online and how it allowed her to be more flexible in her teaching than she ever expected.
In this webinar, Carly goes in-depth about the technology she recommends for private studio owners, and how to use it effectively. She shares the must-have tools needed to make teaching online not just possible, but easy! Carly has recommendations for tools on any budget, including microphone and webcams, software and applications, and billing/payment solutions. She also gives her best tips on how to automate parts of your private studio to streamline your process.
Carly also answers user-submitted questions, including:
- Is it better to pre-record or live-stream your sessions?
- How to use acoustic instruments in online sessions?
- Are there special considerations for vocal students?
- How to use internet MIDI?
And much, much more! Check out the video below for the answers to all of these questions.

6th Sub Junior National Hockey Championship 2016 (women) ‘B’ division in Nagaon, Assam announced by Hockey India. It’ll be the very first Hockey India’s national event in the year of 2016. All the players participating in the tournament are under 16 years of age. Tournament will held from 5th to 13th January.
The national selectors will keep a close eye on the tournament so the players has a golden chance to be selected in the national and international teams if they perform their best in the event. Hockey India has been promoting young stars who can make it big in the international circuit and this tournament since its inception in 2010 has been the breeding ground for it.
Defending Champions Hockey Mizoram would begin their campaign against hosts Hockey Assam on 6th January 2016 4:30 PM onward. Assam is one of the premier venues for Hockey in India and will also witness the staging of the 12th South Asian Games.

Young Lady from Yunnan, lot 101, and Young Boy, lot 102, by Huang Yongyu in this sale were acquired directly from the artist by Wu Tingjie (Ng Ting Chit). Tingjie, father of the consignor, was close friends with Yongyu. Yongyu introduced the consignor's parents to one another, around 1950 in Hong Kong. Both works have remained in the family's collection until their consignment to Heffel.The side annotation dedicates the work to Wu Tingjie (Ng Ting Chit).
All prices are in Canadian Dollars
Although great care has been taken to ensure the accuracy of the information posted, errors and omissions may occur. All bids are subject to our
Terms and Conditions of Business. Bidders must ensure they have satisfied themselves with the
condition of the Lot prior to bidding. Condition reports are available upon request.

Updated on December 10, 2021
Until the newest “Star Wars” film debuts later this year, we’ll have to tide ourselves over with, well, the actual original “Star Wars” trilogy. Those looking for newer material might want to try Disney XD’s “Star Wars: Rebels” animated TV show. Or you might be interested in what real-life astronauts are doing: posing as “Star Wars” Jedi for the poster for an upcoming mission to the International Space Station:
The mission in question is called “Expedition 45,” which will see Russian, American, and Japanese astronauts head to the ISS for a year-long mission.
This isn’t the only instance of astronauts showing their love of something particular. NASA astronaut Leland Melvin recently used his two pet dogs, Jake and Scout, in his official NASA photos:
“@AdamAton: This is an official portrait for astronaut Leland Melvin. I’m in awe. pic.twitter.com/GzqvXryAMH”Thx for the Twitter love Adam. ????

Fort Smith, which began as a western frontier military post in 1817, is steeped in Wild West heritage, and today still has an active military presence. With a population of about 87,000, according to the 2012 U.S. Census, the city is the second-largest in Arkansas. It is perched on the state border between Arkansas and Oklahoma, sitting at the confluence of the Arkansas and Poteau rivers. Not only does Fort Smith serve as an economic hub, it boasts plenty of attractions as well, from the the state’s oldest symphony orchestra to the United States Marshals Service National Museum.
The most common industries are construction, food and health care. Manufacturing is particularly huge in the region, with Fort Smith producing more goods than anywhere else in the state. Some of the manufacturers include Mitsubishi Power Systems America, Planters Peanuts and Graphic Packaging.
The residents of Fort Smith enjoy a relatively warm climate. During the summer, temperatures peak in the 90s and in the winter, they average in the 40s.
Activities and Attractions in Fort Smith
Fort Smith packs a wealth of family-friendly attractions. Get to know the city’s Wild West heritage at the Fort Smith National Historic Site and the Fort Smith Museum of History. Fort Smith is even featured in books and films including “True Grit,” “Hang ‘Em High” and “Lonesome Dove” - only adding to reason why the city was voted “No. 1 Top True Western Town of 2013” by True West Magazine.
Grab tickets to the Fort Smith Symphony to listen to top musicians or ride the old-fashioned train through the Boston Mountains and Ozark foothills.
Fort Smith has a rich nightlife with dozens of restaurants and bars that offer everything from upscale dining to live music to dancing. Some of the popular names include The Electric Cowboy, Harry’s Hamburger Barn and 21 West End.
Moving to Fort Smith
To assist you in your move to Fort Smith, North American Van Lines offers operations in more than 40 countries as well as a total of 380 international agents at your disposal.
Many future residents own delicate items that they would like to transport safely to their new home, but don’t know exactly how. With fragile-only packing, this Fort Smith moving accompany ensures that your most precious belongings get here in one piece.
For those flying here, the closest major airport is Fort Smith Regional Airport, conveniently located 6 miles away. To access the city by car, drive to the junction of Interstates 40 and 540.

Looking for a Rockledge Public Adjuster?It is time to consider hiring a Rockledge Public Adjuster in the event that your home, business or boat in Rockledge Florida suffers damage whether due to Fire, Water, Lightning, Wind, Hail, Tornado, Vandalism, Hurricane or Sinkhole we can help.
Free Consultation with a Rockledge Public Adjuster!When you file an insurance claim your insurance company is going to send out an adjuster that they pay and have trained to handle the claims their way. We on the other hand as your Florida Public Adjusters are hired directly by you, the policyholder. All claim are unique and require their own strategy, however as your Public Adjuster we will often times do the following as part of our services:
- Investigate the loss to determine cause and origin while evaluating damages.
- Review your policy to determine coverage of the claim.
- Prepare a detailed Building Damage Valuation Estimate.
- Prepare a Proof of Loss, if requested or required.
- Meet with the insurance company adjusters to discuss the loss and scope of the damage.
- Meet with Insurance Company “Experts”.
- Bring in our own team of Experts if needed.
- Attempt to reach a fair settlement with the insurance company adjuster.
- If needed on many claims we will assist you through the Appraisal or Mediation Process either with one of our adjusters or with an outside expert which is determined on a case by case basis.
- We will be there with you through the entire claim process with the goal of guiding you and your claim to a satisfactory settlement.
